bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Edgar Mayer, April 28, 1943

div1.p: Hench assures Mayer that he is only interested in the commemoration of the Camp Lazear site and that he is not trying to secure a position on the scientific board of the Finlay Institute. However, if his membership would advance his cause, then he would pursue this endeavour.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Edgar Mayer, April 28, 1943
div1.opener:
STATION HOSPITAL
Camp Carson, Colorado
April 28, 1943
Dr. Edgar Mayer
Four Seventy Park Avenue
New York City, N. Y.
My dear Dr. Mayer:
div1.p:
Every now and then I get a one-line letter from Dr. Fishbein.
The last one was dated March 10, and merely said, “No doubt, we will
take up at the meeting of the Board of the Carlos Finlay Institute in
New York City the question of developing a place for you on the scien-
tific advisory group.” Let me assure you, Dr. Mayer, that I am not
trying to get a place on the Board. While I would be very happy to
cooperate in any way possible, I am first of all interested in the
development of the little memorial project which we discussed, and if
membership in the Board is one way of forwarding that ambition, I
should be delighted to become a member and would be of course inter-
ested in the further proceedings of the Institute. I have been told
that I will probably be left here for an indefinite time. If I ever
have a chance to get to New York on some excuse, I will certainly let
you know ahead of time. I may have to make some excuse and in that
case I may need a little help from you.

I am taking a patient to Los Angeles next Monday, and the
Camp Surgeon has given me permission to spend two or three days on
my yellow fever hobby before returning. While there I will be spend-
ing a day with Mrs. Lazear, widow of Dr. Lazear, and one day with
General Truby who was commanding officer at the hospital in Cuba
where the work was done. These visits should be very interesting.
Thank you again for your interest.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. HENCH
Lieut Colonel, M. C. PSH:ra
